physical_examinations.relevant_findings: Patient was apneic, GCS score of 3 upon arrival, improved to 10 with stimulation, otherwise normal physical examination.
physical_examinations.changes_over_time: GCS score improved from 3 to 10 to 15 after physostigmine administration, heart rate increased from 55 bpm to 110 bpm and then stabilized between 80 to 90 bpm.

physical_examinations.relevant_findings: GCS score of 6 upon arrival, gag reflex was absent, diaphoretic with clenching of fists.
physical_examinations.changes_over_time: GCS score improved from 6 to 11 after two doses of physostigmine and further to 15 later.

physical_examinations.relevant_findings: GCS score of 3 upon arrival improved to 8 with stimulation, otherwise normal physical examination.
physical_examinations.changes_over_time: GCS score increased from 3 to 10 after administration of physostigmine and fully recovered within 15 minutes.
